required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of MF59C.1 Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine in Elderly Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Controlled, Observer-Blind, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity and the Consistency of Three Consecutive Lots of a MF59C.1 Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine in Elderly Subjects Aged 65 Years and Older

brief_summary.textblock: The present phase III study aims to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of MF59-adjuvanted subunit seasonal influenza vaccine and to evaluate the consistency in the manufacturing process of three consecutive lots of MF59-adjuvanted subunit seasonal influenza vaccine with respect to immunogenicity in subjects aged 65 years and older. The active comparator non-adjuvanted seasonal influenza vaccine is approved for use in this age group in the United States and will be used to provide a comparative assessment for immunogenicity and safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Titers in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Lot 1 or Lot 2 or Lot 3 of aTIV
primary_outcome.description: Immunologic equivalence of 3 consecutive production lots of aTIV (Lot 1, Lot 2 and Lot 3), was assessed in terms of Hemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) in subjects, at three weeks after vaccination, against each vaccine strain.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) Against Homologous Strains - PPS
primary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-PPS
primary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-Full Analysis Set (FAS)
primary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-FAS
primary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With HI Titers ≥40 Against Homologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating HI titers ≥40, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against homologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion in HI Titers, Against Homologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion in HI titers from baseline, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against homologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of Post- Versus Pre-vaccination HI Titers Against Homologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The GMR of post-vaccination versus pre-vaccination HI titers (day 22/day 1) in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against homologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With HI Titers ≥40 Against Heterologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating HI titers ≥40, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of Post- Versus Pre-vaccination HI Titers, Against Heterologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The GMR of post-vaccination versus pre-vaccination HI titers (day 22/day 1) in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion in HI Titers, Against Heterologous Strains
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion in HI titers from baseline, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-PPS
secondary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of HI Antibody Responses of aTIV Versus TIV, in High Risk Group in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-PPS
secondary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-FAS
secondary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV, in subjects with predefined co-morbidities (high risk group) assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of HI Antibody Responses of aTIV Versus TIV, in High Risk Group in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-FAS
secondary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of GMTs Against Heterologous Strains-PPS
secondary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV against the heterologous vaccine strains, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination .

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of GMTs Against Heterologous Strains-FAS
secondary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV against the heterologous vaccine strains, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of HI Antibody Responses of aTIV Versus TIV, in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Heterologous Strains-PPS
secondary_outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV against the heterologous strains, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Heterologous Strains-FAS
secondary_outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV against the heterologous vaccine strains, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion, at three weeks after vaccination. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence of GMTs Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
secondary_outcome.description: The GMTs against homologous and heterologous strains, persisting in subjects at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Seroconversion Upto One Year After Vaccination, Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating seroconversion in HI titers against homologous and heterologous strains, at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Influenza Like Illness (ILI) Across Vaccine Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting ILI from three weeks after vaccination to up to one year in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of High Risk Subjects With Exacerbation of Preexisting Chronic Disease, Across Vaccine Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The number of high risk subjects reporting exacerbation of preexisting chronic conditions (i.e.congestive heart failure, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, hepatic disease, renal insufficiency, and neurological/neuromuscular or metabolic disorders including diabetes mellitus) in aTIV group compared to TIV group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Healthcare Utilization Across Vaccine Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects with emergency room visits, unscheduled physician visits, and hospitalizations due to community acquired influenza or pneumonia, cardiopulmonary disease, cardiac disease, respiratory or pulmonary disease,in aTIV group compared to TIV group.

secondary_outcome.measure: All Cause Mortality Rate, Across Vaccine Groups
secondary_outcome.description: The all-cause mortality rate (excluding injury)reported in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic adverse events and other adverse events in aTIV group compared to TIV group.

arm_group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).
Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

intervention.intervention_name: MF59 adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV)
intervention.description: one dose 0.5 mL administered IM in the deltoid muscle of (preferably) the non-dominant arm
one 0.5 mL dose administered IM in the deltoid muscle of (preferably) the non-dominant arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Males and females subjects aged ≥65 years at day of vaccination who are willing and able to comply to study procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Individuals with behavioral or cognitive impairment or a psychiatric condition or with a history of any illness that,in the opinion of the investigator, would have interfered with the subject's ability to participate in the study.
2. Individuals who were not able to comprehend and/or follow all required study procedures for the whole period of the study.
3. Known or suspected impairment/alteration of immune function.
4. Individuals with a known bleeding diathesis.
5. History of Guillain-Barré syndrome.
6. Individuals with history of allergy to vaccine components and/or a history of any anaphylaxis, serious vaccine reactions or hypersensitivity to influenza viral proteins, egg proteins (including ovalbumin), polymyxin, neomycin, betapropiolactone, thimerosal/ sodium ethylmercurothiosalicylate/ mercury and nonylphenolethoxylate/ nonoxynol-9 (spermicide).
7. Receipt of another investigational agent within 30 days prior to enrollment in the study or before completion of the safety follow-up period in another study.
8. Individuals who had received any other vaccines within 2 weeks for inactivated vaccines or 4 weeks for live vaccines prior to enrollment in this study or who had planned to receive any vaccine within 3 weeks from the study vaccine.
9. Individuals who had received vaccination against seasonal influenza in the previous 6 months.
10. Individuals with oral temperature ≥38.0°C (≥100.4°F) on day of study vaccination.
11. Individuals with history of substance or alcohol abuse within the past 2 years.
12. Individuals providing consent who did not consent to the retention of their serum samples after study completion.
13. Elective surgery or hospitalization planned to occur during the treatment phase or during the follow-up phase that, according to the opinion of the investigator, might have poses additional risk to the subject.
14. Subjects from whom blood could not be drawn at visit 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were enrolled from 4 sites in Columbia, 2 sites in Panama, 11 sites in Philippines, 21 sites in USA.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Five enrolled subjects were not randomized and did not receive study vaccination, hence were discontinued.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

baseline.population: Baseline demography is described for safety set population. A vaccine different from the vaccine assigned at randomization was administered to 7 subjects in each vaccine group. For the safety analysis, these subjects were reassigned to the vaccine group for the vaccine they actually received.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Titers in Subjects After Receiving One Dose of Lot 1 or Lot 2 or Lot 3 of aTIV
outcome.description: Immunologic equivalence of 3 consecutive production lots of aTIV (Lot 1, Lot 2 and Lot 3), was assessed in terms of Hemagglutination Inhibition (HI) Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) in subjects, at three weeks after vaccination, against each vaccine strain.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the per protocol set population (PPS) i.e all randomised subjects who received the correct vaccine, provided evaluable serum samples, and had no major protocol deviation prior to unblinding.

outcome.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) Against Homologous Strains - PPS
outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in Terms of Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) Against Homologous Strains - PPS
measure.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.
measure.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.

Seroconversion defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

outcome.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-PPS
outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-PPS
measure.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk subjects), was assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.
measure.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for all 3 homologous strains was >0.67.

outcome.title: Comparison of HI Antibody Responses of aTIV Versus TIV, in High Risk Group in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-PPS
outcome.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Comparison of HI Antibody Responses of aTIV Versus TIV, in High Risk Group in Terms of Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion Against Homologous Strains-PPS
measure.description: The non-inferiority of HI antibody responses of ATIV compared to TIV, in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), assessed in terms of percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion at three weeks after vaccination against the homologous vaccine strains. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
measure.population: Analysis was done on PPS.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 differences in seroconversion rates for all 3 homologous strains was ≥-10%
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 differences in seroconversion rates for all 3 homologous strains was ≥-10%
Non-inferiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 differences in seroconversion rates for all 3 homologous strains was ≥-10%

outcome.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-FAS
outcome.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV, in subjects with predefined co-morbidities (high risk group) assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on FAS population.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Comparison of aTIV Versus TIV in High Risk Group in Terms of GMTs Against Homologous Strains-FAS
measure.description: The superiority of HI antibody responses of aTIV compared to TIV, in subjects with predefined co-morbidities (high risk group) assessed in terms of post vaccination GMTs at three weeks after vaccination against the three homologous vaccine strains.
measure.population: Analysis was done on FAS population.

analysis.groups_desc: Superiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for at least 2 homologous strains was >1.5.
Superiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for at least 2 homologous strains was >1.5.
Superiority was established if the lower bound of the 95% CI for the day 22 vaccine group GMT ratios for at least 2 homologous strains was >1.5.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With HI Titers ≥40 Against Heterologous Strains
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating HI titers ≥40, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the FAS.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects With HI Titers ≥40 Against Heterologous Strains
measure.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating HI titers ≥40, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the FAS.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of Post- Versus Pre-vaccination HI Titers, Against Heterologous Strains
outcome.description: The GMR of post-vaccination versus pre-vaccination HI titers (day 22/day 1) in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the FAS.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Ratio (GMR) of Post- Versus Pre-vaccination HI Titers, Against Heterologous Strains
measure.description: The GMR of post-vaccination versus pre-vaccination HI titers (day 22/day 1) in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the FAS.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Seroconversion in HI Titers, Against Heterologous Strains
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving seroconversion in HI titers from baseline, in overall group and in subjects with pre-defined co-morbidities (high risk group), against heterologous strains, three weeks after vaccination with aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the FAS.

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.

outcome.title: Persistence of GMTs Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
outcome.description: The GMTs against homologous and heterologous strains, persisting in subjects at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV.
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the FAS (persistence) subset population i.e all randomized population only from US sites who received a study vaccination, provided evaluable blood samples at day 1, day 22, day 181, and day 366.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Persistence of GMTs Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
measure.description: The GMTs against homologous and heterologous strains, persisting in subjects at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the FAS (persistence) subset population i.e all randomized population only from US sites who received a study vaccination, provided evaluable blood samples at day 1, day 22, day 181, and day 366.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With Seroconversion Upto One Year After Vaccination, Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating seroconversion in HI titers against homologous and heterologous strains, at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
outcome.population: The analysis was done on the FAS (persistence) subset.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects With Seroconversion Upto One Year After Vaccination, Against Homologous and Heterologous Strains
measure.description: The percentage of subjects demonstrating seroconversion in HI titers against homologous and heterologous strains, at six months (day 181) and one year (day 366) after vaccination with either aTIV or TIV. Seroconversion is defined as prevaccination HI titer <10 and postvaccination HI titer ≥40 or at least a 4-fold increase in HI titers from prevaccination HI titer ≥10.
measure.population: The analysis was done on the FAS (persistence) subset.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Influenza Like Illness (ILI) Across Vaccine Groups
outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting ILI from three weeks after vaccination to up to one year in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the modified full analysis set (mFAS; effectiveness) population i.e all subjects in the randomized population who received a study vaccination but excluding those who received a non-study vaccine during the follow-up phase.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Influenza Like Illness (ILI) Across Vaccine Groups
measure.description: The number of subjects reporting ILI from three weeks after vaccination to up to one year in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the modified full analysis set (mFAS; effectiveness) population i.e all subjects in the randomized population who received a study vaccination but excluding those who received a non-study vaccine during the follow-up phase.

outcome.title: Number of High Risk Subjects With Exacerbation of Preexisting Chronic Disease, Across Vaccine Groups
outcome.description: The number of high risk subjects reporting exacerbation of preexisting chronic conditions (i.e.congestive heart failure, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, hepatic disease, renal insufficiency, and neurological/neuromuscular or metabolic disorders including diabetes mellitus) in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness) population.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Number of High Risk Subjects With Exacerbation of Preexisting Chronic Disease, Across Vaccine Groups
measure.description: The number of high risk subjects reporting exacerbation of preexisting chronic conditions (i.e.congestive heart failure, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary disease (COPD), asthma, hepatic disease, renal insufficiency, and neurological/neuromuscular or metabolic disorders including diabetes mellitus) in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness) population.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Healthcare Utilization Across Vaccine Groups
outcome.description: The number of subjects with emergency room visits, unscheduled physician visits, and hospitalizations due to community acquired influenza or pneumonia, cardiopulmonary disease, cardiac disease, respiratory or pulmonary disease,in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness).

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Healthcare Utilization Across Vaccine Groups
measure.description: The number of subjects with emergency room visits, unscheduled physician visits, and hospitalizations due to community acquired influenza or pneumonia, cardiopulmonary disease, cardiac disease, respiratory or pulmonary disease,in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness).

outcome.title: All Cause Mortality Rate, Across Vaccine Groups
outcome.description: The all-cause mortality rate (excluding injury)reported in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness).

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: All Cause Mortality Rate, Across Vaccine Groups
measure.description: The all-cause mortality rate (excluding injury)reported in aTIV group compared to TIV group, by country.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the mFAS (effectiveness).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
outcome.description: The number of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic adverse events and other adverse events in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
outcome.population: Analysis was done on the safety set i.e all randomized subjects who received a study vaccination and provided postvaccination safety data.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Solicited Adverse Events Following Vaccination
measure.description: The number of subjects reporting solicited local and systemic adverse events and other adverse events in aTIV group compared to TIV group.
measure.population: Analysis was done on the safety set i.e all randomized subjects who received a study vaccination and provided postvaccination safety data.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited adverse events (AEs) were collected from Day 1 to 7 postvaccination; unsolicited AEs from Day 1 to Day 22; Serious AEs from Day 1 to Day 366.

group.title: aTIV (Pooled)
group.description: Subjects received one dose of MF59-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (aTIV) from one of three consecutive lots (Lot 1, Lot 2 or Lot 3).

group.title: Licensed TIV
group.description: Subjects received one dose of non-adjuvanted trivalent subunit influenza vaccine (TIV).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Lung carcinoma cell type unspecified stage IV
Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage unspecified
Squamous cell carcinoma of the cervix

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
